IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: RESIDENTIAL HIGHER EDUCATION COLLEGE SUPPORTING TEACHING AND RESEARCH PROGRAMMES
IRS990.MissionDesc: RESIDENTIAL HIGHER EDUCATION COLLEGE SUPPORTING TEACHING AND RESEARCH PROGRAMMES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The heritage assets held by the college comprise medieval manuscript books (327); medieval and early modern records of the college and its estates dating from the twelfth century (c10,000 pre-1800 items including deeds, surveys, court rolls, maps, and various other records); rare printed books (15th-19th centuries: c14,000; 20th-21st century: 3,500 rare editions and special copies); collections of personal papers (21 mixed-media collections); early astronomical instruments (5); 18th century globes (2); paintings, prints, and drawings (359); sculpture (23); historic table and chapel silver (16); miscellaneous historic furnishings (e.g. chests, clocks etc).
Heritage Assets enable the College to fulfil its charitable objectives which are, for the public benefit, to advance education, learning, research and religion.
Endowment funds are deployed in support of the College and its charitable objectives.
The College does not collect or record data on ethnicity as provided for under the Data Protection Act 2018

Grants are provided only to, or on behalf, of registered members of the College who are engaged in a course of study at the University of Oxford and who have obtained academic testimonials or who are members of faculty at the University of Oxford.
The individuals listed on Form 990 part VII section A line 1A are provided with College accommodation or alternative a housing allowance according to the College's written policies.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is reviewed and signed by the Finance Bursar as the responsible College Officer

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The conflict of interest policy requires notification to the convenor of Trustees of any interest arising at any time and withdrawal of any interested party from any discussion or decision relating to interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation of all Officers is determined by a Remuneration Committee comprising an independent chairperson and up to three other independent members and three independent Trustees. The committee uses comparative data drawn from the University sector and other relevant data to frame decisions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Governing documents, policies and financial statements of the College are published under the freedom of information scheme through the website at www.merton.ox.ac.uk

Legacies and donations received ($2,057,137) plus restricted fund income ($1,673,998) less restricted fund expenditure ($2,058,422) less endowment returned applied to income ($3,916,273) less endowment fund expenditure ($12,857) less revaluation of assets (£1=$1.21776 to £1=1.28571 ($24,699,417)) equals other changes in funds balances total ($xx)
